introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content1: The Rural Development Department was established on 1 May 1960. Rural Development Department of Maharashtra is working for overall development of rural areas. Nationalist villages should be autonomous, all facilities should be available, clean, beautiful and green villages to carry out various activities.
introduction.content2: Maharashtra State Rural Life Mission carries out poverty alleviation activities, provides shelter facilities, and training to empower people and strengthen Panchayati governance.
introduction.content3: At the Ministry level, Hon'ble Minister, Hon'ble Minister of State, and Hon. Additional Chief Secretary lead the department. It oversees 34 district councils, 351 panchayats, and 28,000 gram panchayats across Maharashtra.

visionMission.title: Vision & Mission
items: Create clean, beautiful and green villages.
Undertake poverty alleviation through Maharashtra State Rural Jeevanonnati Abhiyan.
Provide shelter and housing facilities under Indira Awas Yojana.
Strengthen Panchayati Raj system through empowerment and training.

objectives.title: Objectives
items: Implement initiatives to create sustainable rural development.
Provide housing under Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awaas Yojana.
Empower Panchayati Raj System through training programs.

functions.title: Functions
items: Implement Integrated and Sustainable Rural Development Policy 2023–28.
Provide subsidies and monitor rural development programs.
Oversee Panchayat Raj system functioning.
Adopt IT tools for transparent and paperless governance.
Promote flagship programs and women's empowerment initiatives.

rolesResponsibilities.title: Roles & Responsibilities
items: Formulate and implement rural development policies and schemes.
Strengthen Gram Panchayats as units of self-governance.
Coordinate with Zilla Parishads and Panchayat Samitis for program execution.
Monitor and evaluate development projects at village level.
Ensure transparency, accountability, and citizen participation in governance.

keyAchievements.title: Key Achievements
items: Successfully implemented the Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awaas Yojana providing housing to rural poor.
Achieved significant progress in sanitation under Swachh Bharat Mission in villages.
Launched skill development initiatives for rural youth and women.
Improved infrastructure in rural areas including roads, water supply, and electrification.
Digitized Panchayati Raj processes to ensure efficiency and transparency.

aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.content: Our Gram Panchayat works towards the development and welfare of the village community. With transparency and people's participation, we aim to provide essential services, implement government schemes, and promote rural development.
